Bhogagāmanagara：A village in the Vajji country，where the Buddha stayed on his last journey，in the Ananda cetiya，and where he preached a sermon on the four Mahāpadesā （the ＂Great Authorities＂） （D．ii．124f．; A．ii．167ff）．

From Bhoga he went on to Pāvā （D．ii．126）．

Bhoga was one of the places passed by Bāvari’s pupils on their way to Rājagaha．It lay between Pāvā and Vesāli．SN．vs．1013．
